page.title: 07FROG HALL
page.content: LANDSCAPE & BUILDINGS;FROG HALL 120 ac This dwelling was built by the owner/ occupier about 20 yrs. ago. At first glance one is struck by the many windows, this is obviously home for lovers of the countryside, sitting as it does in an area of trees, 2000 +, planted by the owner. Naturlising with the Pines & Silver Birch which were already present are Spruce,Firs,Beech Larch, Magnificient Oaks,Scrub Oaks, & Chestnut to name a few. In September the Rowans were full of berries & the Buddleias full of flower. The R/Hand side of the Hall is a grassed area bordered by many plants including Hostas,Heathers,Varigated Hollies, more conifers and a Monkey Puzzle Tree The front of the Hall has a Lily Pond, flower beds & lawns. There is an avenue of trees which leads to the conservation part of the grounds.
